EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
• Two stone‑furnace units located at (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0) are paired with burner‑inserters and wooden chests. They automatically feed raw materials into the furnaces and collect smelted products, forming the backbone of the base’s early metallurgy.

Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
• A burner‑mining drill positioned at (–15.0, –50.0) works in tandem with an adjacent wooden chest and a network of transport belts. This structure is designed to efficiently extract and transport iron‑ore.

Steam Power Generation System
• A boiler placed at (8.0, 20.5) supplies steam to the network.
• A series of steam engines are distributed around the base to generate electrical power. However, an extra steam engine intended to expand this network remains unplaceable.
• Its designated location is severely congested by overlapping and misaligned burner‑inserters, transport belts, and other interfering entities. In addition, the buildable area near approximately (8.5, 22.5) is obstructed.
  
Automation Research Lab
• A laboratory configured to process automation science packs. It remains nonfunctional due to persistent power connectivity issues.
• Recent diagnostics show that its electrical identifier has changed over time (with the latest reported value around 7807), although the lab still lacks proper integration into the power grid.

Electrical and Transport Infrastructure
• An interconnected network of electricity groups, belt groups, and pipe groups that distribute power and route materials across the base. This infrastructure, while stable, contributes to overall spatial congestion in some areas.

ERROR TIPS
─────────────────────────────
• Persistent Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue
  – The extra steam engine consistently fails to be placed because its designated zone is extremely congested.
  – The boiler area at (8.0, 20.5) is cluttered by overlapping and misaligned burner‑inserters, transport belts, and other entities, while the buildable region near (8.5, 22.5) remains obstructed.
  – To mitigate, conduct a thorough manual inspection of the boiler’s vicinity and connection interfaces. Remove or reposition interfering objects, or consider relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area. Alternatively, reconfiguring the boiler layout may create the necessary spacing.

• Burner‑Inserter Fuel and Material Routing Warnings
  – Multiple burner‑inserters are repeatedly reporting “out of fuel” or “waiting for source items.”
  – Ensure a consistent fuel supply and verify that chests and belts are correctly positioned so that inserters have uninterrupted access to required resources.

• Steam Engine Connectivity Warnings
  – Several steam engines produce warnings such as “not connected to power network,” “no input liquid,” or “no fluid present in connections.”
  – Check the alignment and connectivity of pipes and power interfaces between the boiler and the steam engines. Correcting misalignments and ensuring proper fluid and power routing should alleviate these issues.

• Laboratory Power Deficiency
  – The Automation Research Lab remains unpowered despite repeated diagnostics and updates.
  – Reassess and secure the lab’s electrical connections so that it becomes properly integrated with the active power grid.
